All Classes

Class
Description
Connection
A directed, weighted connection between two Units.
ConstantUnit
A ConstantUnit's output is always a fixed value.
DecayingLearningRateSchedule
Implementation of the ``decaying'' learning rate schedule from AIMA p.
Example
An example is a vector of double values for the inputs and single double value for the output.
Example
An example is a vector of double values for the inputs and a vector of double values for the outputs.
FeedForwardNeuralNetwork
Base class for feed-forward NeuralNetworks, where the connections are only in one direction (that is, it forms a directed acyclic graph).
InputUnit
An InputUnit is a Unit whose output value can be changed after it is constructed, but which doesn't change during training.
LearningRateSchedule
 
LinearClassifier
 
LogisticClassifier
 
LogisticUnit
A LogisticUnit is a Unit that uses a sigmoid activation function.
MultiLayerFeedForwardNeuralNetwork
A MultiLayerFeedForwardNeuralNetwork is a FeedForwardNeuralNetwork with at least one ``hidden'' layer of units between the inputs and the outputs (AIMA Section 18.7.3).
NeuralNetwork
Base class for NeuralNetworks made up of Units.
NeuralNetwork.Tester
Interface implemented by objects that can test a NeuralNetwork.
NeuralNetwork.Trainer
Interface implemented by objects that can train a NeuralNetwork.
NeuralNetworkListener
Interface implemented by objects that want to be notified of changes to a NeuralNetwork during training.
NeuronUnit
Base class for the non-input units of a NeuralNetwork.
PerceptronClassifier
 
PerceptronUnit
A PerceptronUnit is a Unit that uses a hard threshold activation function.
SingleLayerFeedForwardNeuralNetwork
A SingleLayerFeedForwardNeuralNetwork is a single-layer feed-forward network where all the inputs are directly connected to the outputs (AIMA Section 18.7.2).
Unit
Base class for computational elements (``units'') in a NeuralNetwork.
VectorOps
